trial_identification.studytitle: A study to assess the efficacy of a probiotic in the restoration of bowel function of patients undergoing reversal of ileostomy.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A study to assess the efficacy of VSL#3 in the restoration of bowel function of patients undergoing reversal of ileostomy.

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other diseases of the mouth, teeth, oesophagus, digestive system including liver and colon

interventions.interventions:
VSL#3
Dosage: 2.5g sachet twice daily for 4 weeks Ingredients: 450 billion lactic acid bacteria, cornstarch Mode: orally mixed with water or apple juice
interventions.comparator:
Placebo
Dosage: 2.5g sachet twice daily for 4 weeks Ingredients: cornstarch Mode: orally mixed with water or apple juice

primaryOutcome.outcome: To assess the efficacy of VSL#3 in improving the GastroIntestinal Quality of Life Index in patients who have undergone reversal of a loop ileostomy.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: GIQLI assessments weekly for the 4-week study period.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The Bowel Function Diary will include recording frequency of bowel actions, abdominal pain, episodes of nausea and vomiting, incontinence episodes, and probiotic compliance.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Bowel diary completed daily during the 4-week study period.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: 1. Over 18 years of age 2. Able to fill in questionnaires and diary 3. Had an anterior resection or Hartmann's procedure 4. Undergoing reversal of ileostomy

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Division of Surgery 28 Woodville Road Woodville South SA 5011

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Patients experience a period of altered bowel function after the reversal of a temporary loop ileostomy. This study aimed to assess whether a probiotic preparation, VSL#3, improved bowel function during the first month after loop ileostomy reversal.
